title: Jon Gorenc Stanković
text:
Jon Gorenc Stanković (born 14 January 1996) is a Slovenian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who plays for <a href="SK%20Sturm%20Graz">Sturm Graz</a> in the <a href="Austrian%20Football%20Bundesliga">Austrian Football Bundesliga</a> and the <a href="Slovenia%20national%20football%20team">Slovenia national team</a>.
Club career.
Huddersfield Town.
Stanković made his debut for <a href="Huddersfield%20Town%20A.F.C.">Huddersfield Town</a> in an <a href="EFL%20Cup">EFL Cup</a> tie with <a href="Shrewsbury%20Town">Shrewsbury Town</a> on 9 August 2016. He made his league debut as a late substitute against <a href="Rotherham%20United">Rotherham United</a> on 27 September 2016. He scored his first goal for Huddersfield Town on 19 August 2018 in a 6–1 defeat to <a href="Manchester%20City">Manchester City</a>.
Sturm Graz.
On 29 June 2020, Stanković signed a three-year contract with the <a href="Austrian%20Football%20Bundesliga">Austrian Football Bundesliga</a> side <a href="SK%20Sturm%20Graz">Sturm Graz</a>, though he remained at Huddersfield for the remainder of the season, extended due to the <a href="COVID-19">COVID-19</a> pandemic, having signed a short-term extension.
International career.
Stanković was called-up to the senior <a href="Slovenia%20national%20football%20team">Slovenia</a> squad by <a href="Sre%C4%8Dko%20Katanec">Srečko Katanec</a> for a <a href="friendly%20match">friendly</a> against <a href="Turkey%20national%20football%20team">Turkey</a> in June 2016.
Four years after he was first invited to the national team, he made his first appearance in the friendly match against <a href="San%20Marino%20national%20football%20team">San Marino</a> on 7 October 2020.
